intro: Thomasia steetziana, commonly known as the Cape thomasia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South Africa, particularly the Western Cape region, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate and slightly hairy, with a distinct aroma when crushed. Thomasia steetziana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and adaptability to Mediterranean climates.
